SENT.plain: A 63-year-old woman with Behçet disease presented with epigastric pain due to refractory gastric ulcers
Examinations indicated that these ulcers were caused by gastrointestinal Behçet disease
Steroid therapy proved ineffective, so we gave 5mg/kg of infliximab
However, since the patient responded poorly to the treatment the infliximab was discontinued and a total gastrectomy was performed
After surgery, a marginal ulcer developed and infliximab was again administered
Although this brought about improvement in the conditions of the marginal ulcer, infusion-related hypersensitivities in the patient caused polyarthralgia
We therefore discontinued the infliximab treatment and began 40 mg of adalimumab every other week
After 3 months of the new treatment, the patient's marginal ulcer completely healed and her epigastric pain disappeared
This case suggests that adalimumab may be as useful as infliximab for treating refractory gastrointestinal Behçet disease
